item.title: クリエイターがサードパーティのAIツールを使って動画を制作し、サブスクリプションサービスで配信するスタジオ「DreamFlare」が、160万ドルを得てステルス状態から脱却（Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Lauren Forristal / TechCrunch:
DreamFlare, a studio where creators make videos using third-party AI tools and distribute them through a subscription service, emerges from stealth with $1.6M  —  A startup called DreamFlare AI is emerging from stealth on Tuesday with the goal of helping content creators make and monetize short-form AI-generated content.

item.title: 出来事の背後にある感情に焦点を当てた「ニュースポエム」の電信サービスを目指し、寄付者を募っているInstitute for Poetjournalismの様子（Neel Dhanesha/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Neel Dhanesha / Nieman Lab:
A look at the Institute for Poetjournalism, which aims to be a wire service for “newspoems” that focuses on the emotion behind events and is courting donors  —  Institute for Poetjournalism founder Aaron Dworkin hopes a cash prize and a wire service for “newspoems” will help the form take off.

item.title: ソースオラクル創業者のラリー・エリソンがパラマウントとスカイダンスの買収に60億ドルを投資し、RedBird Capital Partnersが残りの20億ドルを拠出（Axios）
item.description:
Axios:
Source: Oracle founder Larry Ellison will invest ~$6B into the Paramount-Skydance deal, with RedBird Capital Partners contributing the remaining $2B  —  - The Ellisons and RedBird have transactional covenants that require they be consulted on any major business decisions by Paramount in the interim, RedBird's Jeff Shell tells Axios.

item.title: サウジアラビアのメディアグループMBCのShahidが、Starz Play Arabiaの18％、Netflixの17％を抑え、22％のシェアでMENA最大のストリーミングサービスになった理由（Financial Times）

Financial Times:
How Saudi media group MBC's Shahid has become the biggest streaming service in MENA with a 22% share, ahead of Starz Play Arabia at 18% and Netflix at 17%  —  Wide range of Arabic-language shows and films helps media group compete with Netflix  —  Media group MBC is competing hard with Netflix …

item.title: OpenAIは先週、自社の記事がオリジナルであることを示すため、記者のメモや取材メモを含むNYTの文書を要求したが、NYTはこれを嫌がらせと呼んでいる（Sherin Shibu/Entrepreneur）
item.description:
Sherin Shibu / Entrepreneur:
OpenAI last week requested NYT documents, including reporters' notes and interview memos, to show that its articles are original; NYT calls it harassment  —  Key Takeaways … Now OpenAI is asking for proof that NYT articles are actually original — and the NYT is calling the request “irrelevant, improper, and harassing.”

item.title: The Interceptの共同設立者ジェレミー・スケーヒルとライアン・グリムDC支局長は、Substackの調査報道サイト「Drop Site News」を立ち上げるために同誌を去る（Jeremy Scahill/Drop Site News）
item.description:
Jeremy Scahill / Drop Site News:
The Intercept co-founder Jeremy Scahill and DC bureau chief Ryan Grim leave the outlet to launch Drop Site News, an investigative news site on Substack  —  A year ago, I never would have imagined sending this email, not to mention publishing on Substack.  But here I am.

item.title: BBCニュース、ジョナサン・マンロ副CEOを新設のグローバル・ディレクターに昇格させ、2024年9月よりBBCモニタリングとワールドサービスを統括（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
BBC News promotes Deputy CEO Jonathan Munro to the newly created role of global director, overseeing BBC Monitoring and the World Service from September 2024  —  BBC News director of journalism and deputy CEO Jonathan Munro has been promoted to global director.

item.title: デヴィッド・エリソンがCEOに就任するスカイダンスの「新生パラマウント」構想：クリエイターを引き込むための15億ドルの資金注入、テックへの注力など（Matt Donnelly/Variety）
item.description:
Matt Donnelly / Variety:
A look at Skydance's vision for “New Paramount”, of which David Ellison will be the CEO: a $1.5B cash infusion to help woo creatives, a focus on tech, and more  —  Now that Shari Redstone has signed on the dotted line to sell her father's media empire to Skydance and RedBird Capital, what future awaits?
